text: My Left Foot: The Story of Christy Brown is a 1989 Irish drama movie directed by Jim Sheridan and starring Daniel Day-Lewis. It tells the true story of Christy Brown, an Irishman born with cerebral palsy, who could control only his left foot. Day-Lewis won the Academy Award for Best Actor for his role as Christy Brown. == Other websites == * Category:1980s biographical movies Category:1989 drama movies Category:English-language movies Category:Irish biographical movies Category:Irish drama movies Category:British biographical movies Category:British drama movies Category:Movies directed by Jim Sheridan Category:Movies set in Dublin Category:Disability
title: My Left Foot (movie)
